name: Monetize your site with Google AdSense (& AdWords)
description:
Turn your passion into profit.

AdSense is a free, simple way to make money online by placing ads on your website.

https://www.google.com/adsense/start/

In our first official meeting as the newly created Google Developers Group (GDG) Mauritius, we are going to look into the opportunities and possibilities to monetize your website with the advertisement and affiliate program by Google.

The meeting will be about general information about AdSense, best practices on using Google AdSense, and we're looking into some technical aspects on how to add Google AdSense to your website (or how to start your own blog with AdSense).

We're looking forward to welcome a vital conversation among attendees to share their experience, questions and recommendations on Google AdSense.

Networking

Of course, you're free to use the breaks for vital networking and exchange of experience. Eventually, we'll talk about latest updates on Developers Conference 2018 and Infotech 2017.
how_to_find_us: ALC is next to Aventure du Sucre, Pamplemousses

name: Build anything with Google: Google Maps APIs
description:
This month we're going to have a look at the various Google Maps APIs

https://developers.google.com/products/develop/#m

Starting with a first integration of the Google Maps JavaScript API to add a map into your web site, we're going to inspect other related APIs. Those APIs will add additional value to your site and provide interesting features.

• Google Maps JavaScript API

• Google Maps Directions API

• Google Maps Distance Matrix API

• Google Maps Elevation API

• Google Maps Geocoding API

• Google Maps Geolocation API

We're trying to provide easy to use examples to get you up and running with Google Maps APIs.

Networking

Of course, you're free to use the breaks for vital networking and exchange of experience. Eventually, we'll talk about latest updates on Developers Conference 2018 and Infotech / Innovtech 2017.

French Hub Mauritius

The French Hub offers a unique workspace of its kind, a wide range of services and allowing you to settle in Mauritius with confidence and to start working on your arrival. More details here: http://www.lefrenchhub.com/en/mauritius-island/

name: Study Jam: Mobile Sites Certification

venue.name: The Ground CoWorking
venue.address_2: IBL Business Park, Royal Road, Cassis - http://www.theground.mu/

description:
• What we'll do
Join us for our Mobile Sites Certification Study Jam

GDG Mauritius is organising a study jam on mobile sites certification. This is a chance to get a professional accreditation that demonstrates you have an understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. By learning together we think it’s going to be more fun and more of us are going to be able to complete it.

Requirements
You need basic web development skills to take part and it typically it takes 3-4 hours to run through the course materials, followed by a 90 minute multiple choice exam. You can find more details on the course here. It’s possible to do it entirely online alone, but we’d like to run through it together as a group.

Why do it?
There is more traffic to mobile sites than desktop yet most sites don’t provide an effective experience for users. Best practice is changing rapidly so what people may have learned a few years ago may not be up to date. For companies and site owners we see better mobile design leading to significant and measurable improvements in customer acquisition, retention and engagement.

Sounds great, where do I sign up?
Just let us know and place your RSVP here.

Background info
The Mobile Sites Certification is part of the Google certification catalog. See here for more details about the certification and the topics we are going to cover during the Study Jam.

https://academy.exceedlms.com/student/path/2967

Networking
As usual there will be opportunities to exchange with other IT geeks and girlz!

• What to bring
Bring your laptop and something to take notes.

• Important to know

name: Create your first machine learning program using TensorFlow
description:
• What we'll do
The meeting will start with a general introduction to Artificial Intelligence. Then, together, we will create your first machine learning program that solves a popular game.

• What to bring
Bring your laptop and try to install Anaconda 3.6 version platform.
https://www.anaconda.com/download/

• Important to know
No previous experience is required. Whether you are a beginner or an expert, feel free to join us.

name: Study Jam: Google Cloud
description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
11:00am - 12:00pm - Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
12:00pm - 12:15pm - Break
12:15pm - 2:00pm - Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
2:00pm: Event ends

name: GDG Study Jam - Machine Learning session
description:
As part of the annual Developer Conference 2018, we will be having an interesting and interactive session on Machine Learning for practitioners and enthusiasts. We will look at real-world case studies, and hands-on practice exercises.

No programming experience is required however please do well to come with your laptops.

name: Google I/O Extended 2018 - Mauritius
description:
Join us for this year's Google I/O Extended event, where we'll bring together desktop, web, mobile, and cloud enthusiasts for the I/O Extended event.

This year, we will be watching several technical keynotes from the recently concluded Google I/O event. We will also have a hands-on session on Flutter (Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time).

Don't forget to bring a laptop (PC, Mac, or Chromebook), and get ready for the best I/O Extended event yet!

Make sure to RSVP to receive upcoming information about this event, and visit https://events.google.com/io/recap/ to learn more about Google I/0 18.
how_to_find_us: On the SSR hospital road, just after the hospital you'll see a sign directing to the African Leadership Campus (our new campus).

name: Flutter workshop 1: Intro to Dart Programming
description:
The Developer Student Club (DSC) ALU which is a grassroots program powered by Google developers will be organizing the first of a series of workshops on Mobile Application Development with Flutter.

This first work will be an introduction to Dart programming which we will subsequently be followed by 2 other workshops on Flutter. This first workshop is intended to lay the foundation needed for effective master of flutter.

You all are invited to join. Simply secure your spot here on meetup.com and endeavor to attend.

name: Intro to Flutter for Mobile app Development
description:
Have you been wondering how to get started with Flutter to develop cross-platform apps? The Developer Student Club at ALU is organizing a second of a series of workshops on mobile app development using Flutter.

Join us this Friday to learn how to get started and build your first mobile app with Flutter. As a requirement for the workshop, please install either Android Studio or IntelliJ. Then also install the Flutter Plugin on any of the editors.

Endeavor to sign up here on meetup.com and show up at the ALU New campus.

name: DevFest Mauritius 2018
description:
It is with great pleasure that we bring to you the biggest and most diverse Google Developer-led conference taking place on the continent known as DevFest.

GDG DevFests are community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.

This year we will be covering multiple product areas such as Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning with TensorFlow, and Mobile Web.

Please expect more updates to follow. In the meantime, you can go ahead and secure your spot here on meetup.com.

name: Women In Tech Meetup
description:
The aim of this meetup is to gather the community of female developers together and engage in a fun activity.

During this meetup, we will engage in a team-based experiential to solve a Google codejam challenge.

Why You Should Come
- Are you already an advanced developer? Perfect, we'd love for you to come and add your wisdom to our discussions.
- Are you a curious cat? Great, this event should give you a pretty good intro into what being a developer means, ie, a thinker!
- Are you an in-betweener? This should be a great way for us (I'm an in-betweener too) to connect the dots in how to advance our development skills.

Looking forward to seeing you on Saturday!

name: Cloud Study Jam
description:
We will be running a Cloud Study Jam through the Developer Student Club at ALC Mauritius.

Our attendees will:
-Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
-Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
-Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what they know about Cloud computing.

Requirements: Come with your laptops as sessions will be very hands-on.
